name: Vegan Queso Cotija
description: This vegan queso cotija is crumbly, salty, and tangy. There’s absolutely no dairy in it and it’s delicious. It is perfect for topping sopes, chilaquiles, enchiladas, gorditas, salads, and pastas.

video.name: Vegan Cotija Cheese
video.description: Vegan Cotija Cheese, cotija cheese made with an almond base, completely dairy-free and healthy.

recipeIngredient: 2 tsp. Brine from a jar of manzanilla olives

recipeInstructions.text: Place the almonds. Lemon juice, brine, and salt in a food processor.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the almonds. Lemon juice, brine, and salt in a food processor.

recipeInstructions.text: Process until you get a crumbly mixture resembling cheese, about 4-5 minutes. Be careful not over process or you’ll end up with almond butter.
recipeInstructions.name: Process until you get a crumbly mixture resembling cheese, about 4-5 minutes. Be careful not over process or you’ll end up with almond butter.

recipeInstructions.text: Place mixture in a cheese cloth or nut bag and twist tight to close and squeeze all of the excess liquid out.
recipeInstructions.name: Place mixture in a cheese cloth or nut bag and twist tight to close and squeeze all of the excess liquid out.

recipeInstructions.text: Place in the refrigerator for 24 hrs.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in the refrigerator for 24 hrs.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove cheese from cloth and crumble.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove cheese from cloth and crumble.
